publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1681 Dennis Canavan: Bombing Raids on Baghdad—That the Parliament condemns the recent bombing raids on Baghdad by US and British aircraft, believing that such irresponsible action is an unjustified threat to the lives of innocent people and will do nothing to weaken the power of Saddam Hussein and his brutal, oppressive regime.
S1M-1681 Bombing Raids on Baghdad (lodged on 20 February 2001) Christine Grahame*
S1M-1681 Bombing Raids on Baghdad (lodged on 20 February 2001) Alex Neil*, Robin Harper*
S1M-1681 Bombing Raids on Baghdad (lodged on 20 February 2001) Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-1681 Bombing Raids on Baghdad (lodged on 20 February 2001) Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Gil Paterson*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*

S1M-1681 Dennis Canavan: Bombing Raids on Baghdad—That the Parliament condemns the recent bombing raids on Baghdad by US and British aircraft, believing that such irresponsible action is an unjustified threat to the lives of innocent people and will do nothing to weaken the power of Saddam Hussein and his brutal, oppressive regime. Supported by: Christine Grahame, Alex Neil, Robin Harper, Tommy Sheridan, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Lloyd Quinan
S1M-1681 Bombing Raids on Baghdad (lodged on 20 February 2001) Linda Fabiani*

S1M-1681 Dennis Canavan: Bombing Raids on Baghdad—That the Parliament condemns the recent bombing raids on Baghdad by US and British aircraft, believing that such irresponsible action is an unjustified threat to the lives of innocent people and will do nothing to weaken the power of Saddam Hussein and his brutal, oppressive regime. Supported by: Christine Grahame, Alex Neil, Robin Harper, Tommy Sheridan, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Linda Fabiani
S1M-1681 Bombing Raids on Baghdad (lodged on 20 February 2001) Ms Sandra White*

S1M-1681 Dennis Canavan: Bombing Raids on Baghdad—That the Parliament condemns the recent bombing raids on Baghdad by US and British aircraft, believing that such irresponsible action is an unjustified threat to the lives of innocent people and will do nothing to weaken the power of Saddam Hussein and his brutal, oppressive regime. Supported by: Christine Grahame, Alex Neil, Robin Harper, Tommy Sheridan, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Linda Fabiani, Ms Sandra White

S1M-1681 Dennis Canavan: Bombing Raids on Baghdad—That the Parliament condemns the recent bombing raids on Baghdad by US and British aircraft, believing that such irresponsible action is an unjustified threat to the lives of innocent people and will do nothing to weaken the power of Saddam Hussein and his brutal, oppressive regime. Supported by: Christine Grahame, Alex Neil, Robin Harper, Tommy Sheridan, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Linda Fabiani, Ms Sandra White
S1M-1681 Bombing Raids on Baghdad (lodged on 20 February 2001) Ms Margo MacDonald*

S1M-1681 Dennis Canavan: Bombing Raids on Baghdad—That the Parliament condemns the recent bombing raids on Baghdad by US and British aircraft, believing that such irresponsible action is an unjustified threat to the lives of innocent people and will do nothing to weaken the power of Saddam Hussein and his brutal, oppressive regime. Supported by: Christine Grahame, Alex Neil, Robin Harper, Tommy Sheridan, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Linda Fabiani, Ms Sandra White, Ms Margo MacDonald

S1M-1681 Dennis Canavan: Bombing Raids on Baghdad—That the Parliament condemns the recent bombing raids on Baghdad by US and British aircraft, believing that such irresponsible action is an unjustified threat to the lives of innocent people and will do nothing to weaken the power of Saddam Hussein and his brutal, oppressive regime. Supported by: Christine Grahame, Alex Neil, Robin Harper, Tommy Sheridan, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Linda Fabiani, Ms Sandra White, Ms Margo MacDonald
